Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: hosna
Reviews.Content: It was our honey moon trip in this hotel, the noisiest hotel I`ve ever stay! it is because of noisy club in ground floor which is open until 3:00 am! The room was small but clean. the food was ok but desserts were excellent! I could`t stop eating! the pool was small and there was nobody in it except me and my husband! hotel is located near to burjman shopping mall and it`s a 10-15min walk away. For a short trip this hotel is OK...

Reviews.Title: “The noisiest Hotel I have ever stayed in. J Johnson North East of England”
Reviews.Author: Joan J
Reviews.Content: We booked half board on the understanding this it was breakfast and evening meal. On arrival we told it was breakfast and lunch and they would not change it. Despite having numerous restaurants in the hotel the food was not suitable for us (we do not like spicy food). The swimming pool area was disappointing, the beds were broken and the pool area was very dirty/dusty (this would have been from the building work going on all around). We were not provided with towels for the pool. The bedroom was clean and spacious but out dated. We had plenty bath towels. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Room service was good. However we did ask several times for milk cartons to make tea in the room - which never arrived. The noise from the nightclub/disco, which started at 9pm, continued every night throughout 7-night stay until 3.00am every morning. We were put into a very nice room on the first night of our stay on the 2nd floor. The noise was so bad we requested a move the next day and were moved to a "quieter" part of the hotel. This was not much better. The glasses actually moved across the table top with the vibration of music. How this hotel can allow this happen is beyond me, when are people supposed to sleep. I would not stay in the hotel again and I would definitely not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible sound system in mini party room of Time Out Club”
Reviews.Author: maheshjaigadkar
Reviews.Content: I visited yesterday to time out as it was a farewell party for our ex-boss. We were allotted a mini party room there to celebrate party. We have enjoyed there as it was totally privacy and we also liked the service of Ms. Roza who have served us very well and I personally thanked for her services and request that the same is conveyed to her. Even the band outside the mini party room was very good and really excellent and amazing performance by the musicians. The sound system was at its best and blasting. There was a karaoke system in the mini party room which was with Indian Karaoke Songs. I am being a professional singer tried to perform on that karaoke and checked the system but it was only having mono sound from the mike and not echo system or professional system required for singers. We have asked for technician but surprisingly a lady captain visited and she informed that there is only a mono system. We were really upset about this and we told this to lady also but she was not concerned about it and left from there. If you have such a fantastic band and sound system at timeout then why such a TERRIBLE BAND kept in the mini party room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel or disco?”
Reviews.Author: asterisk1964
Reviews.Content: I stay in Ramee Royal several times but only this time I'd like to comment. Hotel is located nowhere,close to the petrol pump facing the busy street and locked access for at least 3 years. Reception is trying to be organized and quick but they have lack of problem solving skills. For the size of the room and bed i can rate 8/10 and thats the only plus. Breakfast is average but rich and you can eat well. When dark will come yr trouble will start. On the mezanine there is a Time Out caffe a golden hen for the management and terriblle noisy night club. They turn the bass on maximum always and when you are inside the room you think that ceiling will fall down on you. We complain to the front desk but nobody cares,maximum you will get will be to be transferred to less noisy room but thats only excuse. There is no less noisy rooms. In fact management dont care about guests as Time Out caffe makes triple money than the rooms turnover. My advice! Try to avoid this property,even with the tricks of cheap 4* rooms. Only if you are at twenties and you dont want to use the room

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Lottielots
Reviews.Content: We had been given this hotel as part of a secret hotel deal from lastminute.com. Having read the previous reviews we were a little worried and unfortunately everything said about the noise from the nightclubs is true. We left after 2 nights of terrible sleep. The noise and thudding from the clubs goes on till 3.30am. We tried various rooms and they are all noisy with one room being so bad the curtain rail was vibrating. Awful experience which spoiled the beginning of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “The Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suresh75
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights last month while on a business trip, The hotel is located near metro and close to the main shopping area (Karama, Bur Dubai). The hotel has nice big rooms, clean and spacy but the noise from various Music bars in the first floor will be a disturbance, I've stayed in first floor and first day found it difficult to sleep. The hotel has nice restaurants and the Mirchi restaurant serves excellent Buffet dinner till 11.30PM, which was a great dining experience. The break fast is basic with some south Indian dishes served (I was pleasantly surprised). The hotel charges a very expensive rate for wifi use, which is not worth. The underground parking is basic with stuff every where, the GYM is basic as well. You will like the hotel if you are into Partying and Eating. Choose the rooms in Second floor if you happen to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Unfair Booking Practices”
Reviews.Author: Nina W
Reviews.Content: I inadvertently made a reservation for this hotel through the online site Agoda.com, after their website brought me to the incorrect booking page (I was trying to book for a different hotel). After I realized my mistake, I immediately cancelled my reservation within one hour of the initial booking, which Agoda has always offered the option to do. However, Ramee Hotel has a separate policy, which charges you the first night for any cancellation within 7 days, which was applied. Although I contacted both the hotel and Agoda, they refused to remove the fee - even though the booking was a mistake, and had been cancelled within one hour of making it, and was still 5 days away from the first night stay. It is ridiculous that they cannot make an exception to a situation that was clearly a mistake, and essentially made $65 for doing absolutely nothing at all. If there is even a chance that your travel plans may change or shift, do NOT book with this hotel. They are looking for any excuse to charge extra, and are very inflexible and unhelpful. Very unfair policies - I can only assume that this is indicative of how this hotel would treat guests after they arrive, and I would never stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you want peace and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: H0rse1
Reviews.Content: As has been said in other reviews, if your a party animal and like loud Bass booming through your rooms till 3 am then this is the place for you................................!!

Reviews.Title: “Be warned - there are 2 night clubs which they don't advertise - to noisy.”
Reviews.Author: johnxhamilton
Reviews.Content: To summarise- absolutely not recommended unless you're a party addict and like noise from 9pm to 3am EVERY night! I was moved twice, and on my 3rd request to move they said the whole hotel is noisy. - too right! I tried to move hotel but the one round the corner was fully booked and the other had web booking problems and since I was with an Asian business colleague who didn't mind the noise I ended up sleeping with my mp3's earphones in acting as earplugs for the remaining 4 nights! ( I think he was being polite as it was one of his colleagues who recommended it only because it was the closest to the office I was working in). If you take away the noise the hotel is alright, it's location is poor and is run and operated for Asian guests - food style, music, decor - for me as a westerner it was a bit too much but did not spoil it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again, Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrsmaccy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible, if you are looking for peace and quiet don't bother. It has at least 3 night clubs situated around the hotel and they are very loud. We asked when we arrived to have a quiet room because of the reviews on trip advisor we had read after we had booked the hotel. They told us we had the quietest room in the hotel, but this was not correct, the music was so loud the room was vibrating! We then moved rooms another 2 times until we had a room which was slightly less noisey. On the few nights we managed to get some sleep we were woken at 1am by reception asking if we wanted room service. The pool area looks like its been abandoned, the water is dirty and cloudy, there were sun loungers but some where broken and just left by the side of the pool, there was no shade either. A little plus point on this hotel is the rooms are spacious, and clean. But this does not make up for the noise of it!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: CaptJazz
Reviews.Content: I travelled on business and stayed at this hotel for two nights. The hotel is value for money and centrally located. The Check-in was very quick and the rooms are very neat and clean. The room service food is excellent and the food was quite good, not at all expensive. The hotel staff were very friendly and courteous. If you are travelling on business and looking for a nice budget hotel in central Dubai then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gopjosh
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling in the Middle East namely the GCC countries , while travelling to Dubai i found the Ramee Royal the best place to suit business and travelers who like to see Dubai , the food is good and suitable to every community from Continental to Indian dishes , break fast is inclusive along with coffee and tea , I will any time recommend to lodge into this hotel and have excellent facilities like swimming pool , pubs for the evening to see the friendly atmosphere of the hotel staff . located inthe heart of the city , a nice shopping mall which is Bur - Juman .

Reviews.Title: “A hotel only for Indians”
Reviews.Author: sepehr_sa
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is provided only for Indians themselves the variety of food is only for Indian taste .Everything in this hotel is suspicios , the look of stuffs and ..... you can't rest , the noise of the disoc is disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Disco !”
Reviews.Author: Gopalkhetan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, and could not believe, when suddenly in the middle of night, there was a booming sound ! Complaints to the front desk, were met by coy smiles. The Hotel is good ,fairly price, and reasonable, if you can ignore the noise in the night.

Reviews.Title: “room was nice... but this is more of a disco than a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Jason_in_Redlands
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of this hotel was very negative- we were expecting a shuttle from the airport, but this is non-existent unless you pre-arrange and pay an additional fee (which is more expensive than a taxi). We booked this hotel primarily for the cost, as we had lay overs in Dubai before and after travel to African, so both nights (a Thursday night and a Friday night) we arrived late and just wanted a clean room, with a clean shower, so we could get some solid sleep before continuing our travels. Every night at the Ramee, the CLUB/DISCO jumps into action from midnight to 3am, with super loud bass beats that literally shook our bed. The hotel staff were unwilling to move us to a different room, and on our second stay (which we kept only because it was pre-arranged and would have cost additional fees to cancel) we stayed in the opposite side of the hotel- it was a tad quieter, but not much. Unless you have ear plugs, this is not a good place to sleep. It is extremely loud at hours you'd expect to be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money with great nightlife”
Reviews.Author: andrew_netlas
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel from Agoda.com. I was surprised with the quality of this hotel for the price i paid. The room was huge, clean and spotless. Very beautifully designed room. It is not located in the happening spots of Dubai, but the hotel itself has two or three night clubs attached and several restaurants attached. The night club were very happening. With so many options in the same building, there is no need to look for any other outside. The breakfast was a huge spread of Continental and Indian. Very good quality breakfast. I would definitely recommend all my friends to stay there when they are visiting Dubai. This place is for families and single men and women. A Totally happening venue.

Reviews.Title: “Disco hell”
Reviews.Author: SAPStar
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, I booked this hotel on the internet as a stop over in Dubai based on location and price. Close to the airport, but the wrong side of the Dubai Creek which makes it difficult to get downtown (take the water taxi). Main problem like many of the reviews is loud disco music that you cannot avoid and runs from 9pm until 3am. Check in took ages arriving at 1am. Internet is free, but very limited and keeps cutting out. Rooms are good quality, but if you cannot sleep, there is not much point. Party goers only.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not stay in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashok1951
Reviews.Content: Due to Two night clubs on the Midlle Floor you just can not sleep because of tooooo loud noise till 3.00 am in the morning hence you can not sleep. we were on the 1st Floor. the Indian Restaurant was good

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and food choice for the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Drimran
Reviews.Content: Dr Imran Majid I stayed with my family of 3 young kids and my wife and we found the hotel to be pleasant on an overall basis. the staff was really courteous and our check-in as well as check-out was without any hassles. The staff at the breakfast restaurant were really courteous and took extra care of our kids. The choice of food at the breakfast restaurant was really really good-- enjoyed every breakfast during the stay. The location of the hotel is exceptionally good-- close to a number of attractions in Dubai including Dubai Dolphinarium and Gold Souke The only nagging point was a bit of a noise from the discos-- however, we were offered a noise-free room and that settled the problem

Reviews.Title: “Torture By Noise - Hotel From Hell !!!”
Reviews.Author: calgarytraveler0
Reviews.Content: Pre-booked and paid on the hotels.com (Expedia Partner) what a mistake. The first step into the lobby and the intense curry smell engulfs you. Room was tired but acceptable. Definitely not 4* as indicated on the web. The real disaster hit at 9Pm the loud music from the disco upstairs till 3AM. The base was so high that one could feel the bones and the lungs vibrating, never mind the glasses and other stuff. Management was aware of the problem and accepted that it was horrible. They admitted that upper management lets this happen every nite due to the cash flow generated by the discos. Unbearable -Unacceptable- Inhuman- Never, never never stay in this hotel from hell. Sleeping on a park bench is a more respectable option. Calgary Traveller... PS. The swimming pool is like a dump site, if you look carefully there may be even a dead body..so creepy and disgusting...

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: markforothers
Reviews.Content: Families must be never go there and also the people that want to sleep after 5 o' clock in the morning. the music of the 2 indian bars shaking all the hotel till 3 o'clock in the morning and the mpordelo with hookers at the 4th floor also. Idiots people are round all the hotels ,so no safetry as nobody check them at the entry of the hotel. Only for people that interest to have sex and drink alcohol need to go there. Real nightmare for normal people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and warm staff”
Reviews.Author: D0ha Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be very helpful and provided good service. The breakfast buffet was decent and would recommend this. Only points I would like to add is if you have family and small children stay away as the evening music is too loud.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: sam_michael64
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for as business trip after my travel agent in Melbourne made a booking there, Front office and Housekeeping staff was extremely courteous, Sales team made sure that all my special needs were taken care of with in no time... rooms were extremely spacious with complimentary Wi-Fi and breakfast, all included in the package along with shuttle service to the hotel from the airport. Massages was another beautiful experience.. will come back again and again... Thank You Ramee Royal!!

Reviews.Title: “nice service and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: deependraus
Reviews.Content: I really liked the kind of homely service they provided. I felt the prices a bit steep but probably worth the money. I would love to stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramee Royal Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Khalid Bin Waleed Street, Bur Dubai, Al Karama | Along side Al Maktoum Bridge, Dubai 26816, United Arab Emirates
